source.b0af7879:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.db7fb08a:
plt.figure(figsize=(27,10))
sns.countplot(x='winner',data=match) #Team that won max number of times
plt.show()
source.267a1331:
s=match.groupby(['winner'])['win_by_runs'].sum()
s.sort_values(ascending=False,inplace=True)
fig,ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(20,10))
plt.title("Winner based on runs") #Winner based on max runs
s.plot.bar()
source.1f57c086:
s=match.groupby(['winner'])['win_by_wickets'].sum()
s.sort_values(ascending=False,inplace=True)
fig,ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(20,10))
plt.title("Winner based on maximum wicket") 
s.plot.bar()
source.5feb7e32:
s=match["toss_winner"].value_counts()
ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(20,10))
plt.title('Maximum toss winner') 
s.plot.bar()
source.ee898895:
s=match["venue"].value_counts().sort_values(ascending=False)
ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(20,10))
plt.title('Most used Stadium') #Most used stadium
s.plot.bar()
source.2a7692a6:
**CONCLUSION:** From the given data,we can conclude the following.
1. The team that won IPL for maximum number of times is Mumbai Indians.
2. The team that won based on maximum number of runs is Mumbai Indians.
3. The player who won 'MAN OF THE MATCH' maximum number of times is CH Gayle.
4. Eden Gardens is the most used Venue for IPL.
5. Team that won maximum number of matches season-wise:
> 2008: Rajasthan Royals
> 2009: Delhi DareDevils
> 2010: Mumbai Indians
> 2011: Chennai SuperKings
> 2012: Kolkata Knight Riders
> 2013: Mumbai Indians
> 2014: Kings XI Punjab
> 2015: Mumbai Indians
> 2016: Sunrises Hyderabad
> 2017: Mumbai Indians
> 2018: Chennai SuperKings
> 2019: Mumbai Indians
